result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Eric Devon Blue not in court, in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defendant in custody, not produced.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Defense has received discovery, offer and requests a trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Heather Johnson requested adjournment, via email, due to being in Trial in another Court.  No objection from State.  Court grants adjournment.  Both parties agreed to new Scheduling Conference date, via email.  Case scheduled for Scheduling Conference July 11, 2022, at 8:30 am.

Defendant Eric Devon Blue in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Eric Devon Blue in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense has received Offer from State.  Defense requesting time for review.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Devon Blue in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Eric Devon Blue in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eric Devon Blue appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective Jolene Del Moral - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Devon Blue in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Eric Devon Blue in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Status of Counsel held.  Defense makes first appearance.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Devon Blue not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter set for Preliminary Hearing. Defense informed the clerk via e-mail that she had the incorrect date and requests adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case calendared for Status of Counsel March 25, 2022.  Attorney Heather Johnson appointed to represent Defendant but is unavailable that date.  Parties agree via email to March 31, 2022 at 1:30 pm.  bm
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Defendant Eric Devon Blue in court with attorney Thomas Holland Reed.  Defendant Eric Devon Blue in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case in Court for State v Lee Hearing.  Attorney Reed advises they should have an attorney appointed by the next date and requests adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Eric Devon Blue not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eric Devon Blue not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eric Devon Blue not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with CFP (DOB: 4/21/2015); KLB (DOB: 4/26/2017)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list. 
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Eric Devon Blue in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Eric Devon Blue in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eric Devon Blue appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant hemay qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
